nodes.name: Billy Mays Room Door (to Boulder Room)
Missile (blue Brinstar top)
Missile (blue Brinstar behind missile)
Boulder Room Left Door (to Billy Mays)
Boulder Room Right Door (to Ceiling E-Tank)

strats.name: Wall Jump
strats.note: Wall jump when the water is low.

strats.name: Crouch Jump Down Grab
strats.note: Crouch jump down grab when the water is high.

strats.name: Careful Jump
strats.note: Shoot open the door and jump through it without going into the water below.

strats.name: Leave Charged (Suitless)
note: Shoot the bridge to see where it ends.
Opening the door requires a shot that is fired while Samus has some momentum from running to the right.
Charge a spark running left then run off right into a preopened door.
devNote: Using the second openEnd means you cannot make it to the door in time.
Could attach `canMomentumShot` tech if that gets added.
Emphasis on Careful.  There is no jump.

strats.name: Space Jump
strats.devNote: Space Jump with HiJump alone is enough if the door can be opened.

strats.name: Boulder Room Jump Through the Door
strats.note: A doorsill with an open end is really all the room that's needed on the other side.

strats.name: Boulder Room Doorsill Jump
strats.note: It's not even necessary to jump through the door, the in-room doorsill gives enough running room to make it up.

strats.name: Boulder Room Naked Walljump
note: It's a delayed walljump while the water is low, followed by a tight walljump off the bridge.
This strat is easily bypassed by jumping through the door, or if the door can be opened.

strats.name: G-Mode Direct Doorsill Jump
strats.note: In direct g-mode, the door will not close, and the in-room doorsill gives enough running room to make it up to the invisible ledge.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Spring Ball IBJ
strats.note: Starting an IBJ from spring ball with no other items is not very precise, it just takes a bit of an odd timing.

nodes.name: Ceiling E-Tank Bottom Left Door (to Construction Zone)
Ceiling E-Tank Top Left Door (to Boulder Room)
Energy Tank, Brinstar Ceiling
Missile (blue Brinstar middle)
G-Mode Morph Junction (Bottom)
nodes.note: Represents being in the room with G-Mode, to the right of the two Geemers, with morph or artificial morph.

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction Direct (Bottom)
nodes.note: Represents being in the room with G-Mode, to the right of the two Geemers, with morph or artificial morph, in direct G-Mode.

strats.name: Leave Charged - Power Bomb Blocks Broken
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
IBJ
strats.devNote: Would've been notable due to breaking the shot block while maintaining ibj, but there's a tech for that.

strats.name: IBJ with Power Bomb
strats.devNote: Use a Power Bomb while performing an IBJ to break the shot block while part way up.

strats.name: Ceiling E-Tank Jump Into IBJ
strats.note: An alternate strat to canBombAboveIBJ. Shoot the block, jump into an IBJ, then do a quick double bomb jump to make it in time.

strats.name: Blue Brinstar E-Tank Ceiling Damage Boost
note: Have Samus shoot the shot block revealing the item and then quickly get hit by an enemy at the peak of her jump in order to reach the item.
No directional inputs should be held while getting hit by the enemy in order to have a neutral boost and reach the item.
This is traditionally done with the swooping Reo; after a few failed tries, it may help to reset the room to reposition it.
The global Geemer may be easier to use, although it takes longer to get there; jump as it starts moving horizontally again while it is 3 tiles away from the item.
strats.devNote: Although the Reo is traditionally used for the boost, the Geemer does less damage and should still put this in logic with low energy.

strats.name: Ceiling E-Tank Speed Jump
strats.note: Does not require a shinespark. You can shoot the block, then just run and jump.

strats.name: Ceiling E-Tank Unmorph Bomb Boost
note: Reveal the item and then setup to jump into an IBJ.
As Samus starts falling, unmorph to extend Samus' hitbox high enough to reach the item after bouncing on the bomb.
strats.devNote: It is a JumpIntoIBJ that bounces on a single bomb or Power Bomb.

strats.name: Taco Tank in Blue Brinstar Energy Tank Room
strats.note: Triple frame perfect dashing stationary spinjump into delayed CWJ and precise hitbox manipulation.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
devNote: It is possible to roll off of the ledge and avoid the Geemers, but it's very tight and not expected here, as farming for immobile is likely easier.
An immobile strat only takes one hit on entry, skipping the Geemer hit, which is modeled by going 1->6->5.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph with Flashing Lights
note: The eye scanners are particularly annoying while in g-mode. They scan Samus with bright flashing lights which remain for a further distance.
This is notable so a player can disable having to enter these flashing lights. If disabled, Samus will only require being in g-mode in this room if Zebes is awake.
devNote: It is possible to roll off of the ledge and avoid the Geemers, but it's very tight and not expected here, as farming for immobile is likely easier.
An immobile strat only takes one hit on entry, skipping the Geemer hit, which is modeled by going 1->6->5.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.devNote: It is possible to roll off of the ledge and avoid the Geemers, but it's very tight and not expected here.

strats.name: G-Mode Immobile Morph
strats.devNote: The immobile case is included as a separate strat, since the Geemer hit to restore mobility provides i-frames eliminating a need to account for a subsequent Geemer hit (or a way to evade it).

strats.name: G-Mode Morph with Flashing Lights
note: The eye scanners are particularly annoying while in G-mode. They scan Samus with bright flashing lights which remain for a further distance.
This is notable so a player can disable having to enter these flashing lights. If disabled, Samus will only require being in g-mode in this room if Zebes is awake.

strats.name: G-Mode Immobile Morph with Flashing Lights
note: The eye scanners are particularly annoying while in G-mode. They scan Samus with bright flashing lights which remain for a further distance.
This is notable so a player can disable having to enter these flashing lights. If disabled, Samus will only require being in G-mode in this room if Zebes is awake.
strats.devNote: The immobile case is included as a separate strat, since the Geemer hit to restore mobility provides i-frames eliminating a need to account for a subsequent Geemer hit (or a way to evade it).

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer - Broken Crumble Blocks
strats.note: Falling down the shaft and breaking the crumble block does not require Morph.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer - Broken Power Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Falling down the shaft and breaking the crumble block does not require Morph.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer - Blocks Already Broken
strats.note: Falling down the shaft and breaking the crumble block does not require Morph.

strats.name: Temporary Blue
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Artificial Morph Remotely Collect the Item
strats.note: After touching the item, roll back to the left before exiting G-Mode and remotely collect it.
strats.devNote: This does not include canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, because the only reason to do this strat is if the item is there.

strats.name: Blue Brin E-Tank Return Through Crumble Blocks
strats.note: The Crumble Block does not respawn, so it's possible to grab the items and go back up without breaking the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Base strat when entering the room from below.
strats.devNote: canWallJumpInstantMorph is not needed here, as the precision is very low.

strats.name: Power Bomb and Bombs
strats.note: Placing the bomb against the bomb block at the top of the shaft can be somewhat tricky.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: The runway here is 31 tiles before breaking the Power Bomb blocks, but becomes longer after.

strats.name: Walljump Up Shaft and Shinespark
note: Breaking the Power Bomb blocks exactly wide enough makes it easier to quickly enter the one-tile gap.
Aligning the Power Bomb with the left side of the ceiling fixture that sticks down will position the explosion correctly for this.
strats.devNote: The runway here is 31 tiles before breaking the Power Bomb blocks, but becomes longer after.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Touch the Item to Overload PLMs
strats.note: After overloading the PLMs by touching the item, go through the crumble and bomb blocks to the top door.
strats.devNote: The setup for this strat is where the obstacle is cleared.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ
strats.note: Overload PLMs by repeatidly bombing the Power Bomb blocks or the side of the crumble block, then enter through the crumble block.
strats.devNote: The off screen movement is just during an IBJ, and only if wall jumps are disabled. But the IBJ is long and Samus is covered for most of it.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph with Power Bomb
strats.note: The blocks will not break if PLMs are already overloaded. Exiting G-Mode before the Power Bomb explodes will ensure they break.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb the Item
note: Overload PLMs with a single Power Bomb by hitting the item at the right end of the room.
This can be done with a single precisely placed Power Bomb. There should be 4 empty tiles between Samus and the left of the blocks when the bomb is placed.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Remotely Collect the Item
note: Touch the item to either roll back to the left before exiting G-Mode and remotely collect it,
or to overload PLMs and go up through the crumble block and bomb block.
devNote: This will force Samus to pick up the item, so it can only be done once.
This does not include canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess if Samus only uses this to return to the left with the item.

nodes.name: Construction Zone Top Left Door (to Morph Ball)
Construction Zone Right Door (to Ceiling E-Tank)
Construction Zone Bottom Left Door (to Alpha Missiles)
Construction Zone Top Junction

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
strats.note: Carefully shoot the shoot blocks at the right time to knock off a Geemer without killing it.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Shoot a Super at the wall, while the Geemer is moving vertically. If it is on the bottom of the shot blocks, it will not fall.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
strats.note: Carefully shoot the shoot blocks at the right time to knock off a Geemer without killing it.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Shoot a Super at the wall, while the Geemer is moving vertically. If it is on the bottom of the shot blocks, it will not fall.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
strats.note: Carefully shoot the shoot blocks at the right time to knock off a Geemer without killing it.

strats.name: Construction Room X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This is a short climb of only a few tiles.

nodes.name: First Missiles Room Door (to Construction Zone)
Missile (blue Brinstar bottom)
Morph Ball Room Left Door (to Green Hill Zone)
Blue Brinstar Elevator to Crateria
Morph Ball Room Right Door (to Construction Zone)
Morphing Ball
devNote: This item is technically no longer spawned after Zebes is awake, which would require canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.
The logic here is not modeling that, as that bug is likely not going to be kept by anyone that utilizes this data.

nodes.name: Power Bomb (blue Brinstar)
Morph Ball Room Junction (Right of Sidehoppers)

strats.name: Leave Charged
strats.devNote: Destroy obstacle C by travelling between nodes 1 and 6.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Sidehopper
Room Entry Speedball
devNote: This is a direct link because clearing the hoppers is unnecessary.
One tile is subtracted from the runway length since Samus must be blue before contacting the first Hopper.
There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs Zebes Asleep
strats.note: Overload the PLMs by rolling through the camera scroll blocks which are 4 tiles to the right of the stair by the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs Indirect
note: Either kill the Sidehoppers immediately on entry by placing a Power Bomb while rolling off the stair or tank their hits.
If Samus has Morph Ball, it is also possible to kill the Sidehoppers upon room entry with Screw Attack or a powerful beam.
Overload the PLMs by rolling through the camera scroll blocks which are 4 tiles to the right of the stair by the door.
Roll under the last Sidehopper and through the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs Direct
note: Tank the Sidehopper hits or kill them after a single hit by quickly placing a Power Bomb.
It is also possible to kill the Sidehoppers with a very fast Screw Attack, if Samus has Morph Ball.
Overload the PLMs by rolling through the camera scroll blocks which are 4 tiles to the right of the stair by the door.
Roll under the last Sidehopper and through the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Quick Sidehopper Kill
note: For the Power Bomb and Screw Attack kills, this strat assumes you don't know you're entering the room beforehand.
If you know, it's possible to Power Bomb kill the first two Sidehoppers damage-free by morphing before entering.
For Screw, just entering with a spin jump would work.

strats.name: Kill on Entry
note: Enter the room ready to kill the hoppers before they can hit Samus.
with a charge plasma shot ready, or in a screw attack spin jump, or a morph, ready to lay a power bomb.

strats.name: Power Bomb Sidehopper Kill and Bomb Blocks
note: This strat assumes you don't know you're entering the room beforehand. Otherwise, it's possible to kill the first two Sidehoppers without taking damage.
It's possible to take out obstacle A alongside the third Sidehopper, but there's a risk of taking an additional hit (negated by mockball).

strats.name: Free Passage
strats.devNote: The obstacle isn't really cleared, but should enable all strats that require it to be.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb the Blocks
strats.note: Place the Power Bomb, then exit g-mode before the bomb goes off.

strats.name: Power Bomb Blocks While in Artificial Morph from the Left
strats.note: Place the Power Bomb, then exit g-mode before the bomb goes off.

strats.name: Morph Ball Room Speedball (Right to Left)
note: It's a short charge into a speedball to break the Bomb Blocks.
The Power Bomb Blocks need to be destroyed to have enough running room.

strats.name: Safe Sidehopper Power Beam Kill
strats.note: If the bomb blocks are broken, the SideHoppers can be killed safely from behind with Power Beam.
strats.devNote: Obstacle can be broken by going to 5 and back.

strats.name: Free Passage
strats.devNote: The obstacle isn't really cleared, but should enable all strats that require it to be.

strats.name: Morph Ball Room Speedball (Left to Right)
note: It's a short charge into a speedball to break the bomb blocks.
The Sidehoppers need to be destroyed beforehand to clear the running space.
